team_type.description: Account team project type, can one of the following values: admin, developer, operator and read_only

connection_uri.description: URI for connecting to the pool

database_name.description: Name of the database the pool connects to

pool_mode.description: Mode the pool operates in (session, transaction, statement)

pool_size.description: Number of connections the pool may create towards the backend server

project.description: Project to link the connection pool to

service_name.description: Service to link the connection pool to

username.description: Name of the service user used to connect to the database

lc_collate.description: Default string sort order (LC_COLLATE) of the database. Default value: en_US.UTF-8

lc_ctype.description: Default character classification (LC_CTYPE) of the database. Default value: en_US.UTF-8

project.description: Project to link the database to

service_name.description: Service to link the database to

termination_protection.description:
It is a Terraform client-side deletion protections, which prevents the database
			from being deleted by Terraform. It is recommended to enable this for any production
			databases containing critical data.

enabled.description: Enable Elasticsearch ACLs. When disabled authenticated service users have unrestricted access

extended_acl.description: Index rules can be applied in a limited fashion to the _mget, _msearch and _bulk APIs (and only those) by enabling the ExtendedAcl option for the service. When it is enabled, users can use these APIs as long as all operations only target indexes they have been granted access to

project.description: Project to link the Elasticsearch ACLs to

service_name.description: Service to link the Elasticsearch ACLs to

permission.description: Kafka permission to grant (admin, read, readwrite, write)

project.description: Project to link the Kafka ACL to

service_name.description: Service to link the Kafka ACL to

topic.description: Topic name pattern for the ACL entry

username.description: Username pattern for the ACL entry

project.description: Project to link the kafka connector to

service_name.description: Service to link the kafka connector to

task.description: List of tasks of a connector

project.description: Project to link the Kafka Schema to

schema.description: Kafka Schema configuration should be a valid Avro Schema JSON format

service_name.description: Service to link the Kafka Schema to

project.description: Project to link the Kafka Schemas Configuration to

service_name.description: Service to link the Kafka Schemas Configuration to

cleanup_policy.description: Topic cleanup policy. Allowed values: delete, compact

minimum_in_sync_replicas.description: Minimum required nodes in-sync replicas (ISR) to produce to a partition

partitions.description: Number of partitions to create in the topic

project.description: Project to link the kafka topic to

service_name.description: Service to link the kafka topic to

termination_protection.description:
It is a Terraform client-side deletion protection, which prevents a Kafka 
			topic from being deleted. It is recommended to enable this for any production Kafka 
			topic containing critical data.

billing_address.description: Billing name and address of the project

billing_emails.description: Billing contact emails of the project

ca_cert.description: Project root CA. This is used by some services like Kafka to sign service certificate

copy_from_project.description: Copy properties from another project. Only has effect when a new project is created.

country_code.description: Billing country code of the project

project.description: Project name

technical_emails.description: Technical contact emails of the project

accepted.description: Whether the user has accepted project membership or not

member_type.description: Project membership type. One of: admin, developer, operator

project.description: The project the user belongs to

network_cidr.description: Network address range used by the VPC like 192.168.0.0/24

project.description: The project the VPC belongs to

state.description: State of the VPC (APPROVED, ACTIVE, DELETING, DELETED)

maintenance_window_dow.description: Day of week when maintenance operations should be performed. One monday, tuesday, wednesday, etc.

maintenance_window_time.description: Time of day when maintenance operations should be performed. UTC time in HH:mm:ss format.

project.description: Target project

project_vpc_id.description: Identifier of the VPC the service should be in, if any

max_index_count.description: Maximum number of indexes to keep

elasticsearch_request_timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for requests made by Kibana towards Elasticsearch

alerting_enabled.description: Enable or disable Grafana alerting functionality

alerting_error_or_timeout.description: Default error or timeout setting for new alerting rules

alerting_nodata_or_nullvalues.description: Default value for 'no data or null values' for new alerting rules

allow_embedding.description: Allow embedding Grafana dashboards with iframe/frame/object/embed tags. Disabled by default to limit impact of clickjacking

auth_basic_enabled.description: Enable or disable basic authentication form, used by Grafana built-in login

cookie_samesite.description: Cookie SameSite attribute: 'strict' prevents sending cookie for cross-site requests, effectively disabling direct linking from other sites to Grafana. 'lax' is the default value.

dashboards_versions_to_keep.description: Dashboard versions to keep per dashboard

dataproxy_timeout.description: Timeout for data proxy requests in seconds

disable_gravatar.description: Set to true to disable gravatar. Defaults to false (gravatar is enabled)

editors_can_admin.description: Editors can manage folders, teams and dashboards created by them

google_analytics_ua_id.description: Google Analytics Universal Analytics ID for tracking Grafana usage

user_auto_assign_org.description: Auto-assign new users on signup to main organization. Defaults to false

user_auto_assign_org_role.description: Set role for new signups. Defaults to Viewer

viewers_can_edit.description: Users with view-only permission can edit but not save dashboards

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

mysql.description: Allow clients to connect to mysql from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

host.description: PostgreSQL master node host IP or name

replica_uri.description: PostgreSQL replica URI for services with a replica

admin_password.description: Custom password for admin user. Defaults to random string. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

admin_username.description: Custom username for admin user. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

backup_hour.description: The hour of day (in UTC) when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

backup_minute.description: The minute of an hour when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

pg_read_replica.description: Should the service which is being forked be a read replica

pg_service_to_fork_from.description: Name of the PG Service from which to fork (deprecated, use service_to_fork_from). This has effect only when a new service is being created.

recovery_target_time.description: Recovery target time when forking a service. This has effect only when a new service is being created.

service_to_fork_from.description: Name of another service to fork from. This has effect only when a new service is being created.

synchronous_replication.description: Synchronous replication type. Note that the service plan also needs to support synchronous replication.

variant.description: Variant of the PostgreSQL service, may affect the features that are exposed by default

ignore_startup_parameters.description: List of parameters to ignore when given in startup packet

server_reset_query_always.description: Run server_reset_query (DISCARD ALL) in all pooling modes

pg.description: Allow clients to connect to pg with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

pgbouncer.description: Allow clients to connect to pgbouncer with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

pg.description: Allow clients to connect to pg from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

pgbouncer.description: Allow clients to connect to pgbouncer from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

redis_lfu_decay_time.description: LFU maxmemory-policy counter decay time in minutes

redis_lfu_log_factor.description: Counter logarithm factor for volatile-lfu and allkeys-lfu maxmemory-policies

host.description: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

password.description: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.description: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.description: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.description: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

redis.description: Allow clients to connect to redis with a DNS name that always resolves to the service's private IP addresses. Only available in certain network locations

prometheus.description: Allow clients to connect to prometheus from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

redis.description: Allow clients to connect to redis from the public internet for service nodes that are in a project VPC or another type of private network

integration_type.description: Type of the service integration. The only supported value at the moment is 'read_replica'

endpoint_name.description: Name of the service integration endpoint

endpoint_type.description: Type of the service integration endpoint

project.description: Project the service integration endpoint belongs to

max_partition_contexts.description: Maximum number of partition contexts to send

site.description: Datadog intake site. Defaults to datadoghq.com

index_days_max.description: Maximum number of days of logs to keep

sd.description: Structured data block for log message

server.description: rsyslog server IP address or hostname

access_cert.description: Access certificate for the user if applicable for the service in question

access_key.description: Access certificate key for the user if applicable for the service in question

project.description: Project to link the user to

service_name.description: Service to link the user to

peer_cloud_account.description: AWS account ID or GCP project ID of the peered VPC

peer_region.description: AWS region of the peered VPC (if not in the same region as Aiven VPC)

peer_vpc.description: AWS VPC ID or GCP VPC network name of the peered VPC

peering_connection_id.description: Cloud provider identifier for the peering connection if available

vpc_id.description: The VPC the peering connection belongs to
